P. 17 6/31)CABINET.RENT RESTRICTION ACTS.Amending Legislation.Memorandum "by the Minister of Health and the Secretary of State for Scotland.As our colleagues are aware, the Report of the Interdepartmental Committee on the Rent Restrictions Acts has been presented and will very shortly "be published. The exist-ing Acts are due to expire, as regards England and Wales, on 25th December next, and as regards Scotland on 28th May next, and it will be necessary to make some announcement before the Parliamentary recess as to the course which the Government propose to adopt.In view of existing legislative commitments, it will be impossible^ Ytetazas^ss^^aaatoi^^e^igmK3m^d^3ise^!cto^ to rely on the passage into law before Christmas of a substantive bill founded on the Report of the Committee. In these circumstances it will be necessary to include in the Expiring Laws Continuance Bill provisions for extending the life of the existing Rent Restrictions Acts in both countries for twelve months and to introduce amending legislation early next year, such legislation to have effect from the date of the Royal Assent or such other date as may be named therein.Authority is desired from the Cabinet to make an announcement to the above effect before Parliament rises.(Intld.)
